body:
I saw this on one of our GKE tests that run from head. Full dump below:
```
sudo systemctl status kube-master-configuration
● kube-master-configuration.service - Configure kubernetes master
   Loaded: loaded (/etc/systemd/system/kube-master-configuration.service; enabled; vendor preset: disabled)
   Active: failed (Result: exit-code) since Fri 2017-01-13 09:13:45 UTC; 1h 39min ago
  Process: 1262 ExecStart=/home/kubernetes/bin/configure-helper.sh (code=exited, status=1/FAILURE)
  Process: 1258 ExecStartPre=/bin/chmod 544 /home/kubernetes/bin/mounter (code=exited, status=0/SUCCESS)
  Process: 1255 ExecStartPre=/bin/chmod 544 /home/kubernetes/bin/configure-helper.sh (code=exited, status=0/SUCCESS)
 Main PID: 1262 (code=exited, status=1/FAILURE)

Jan 13 09:13:45 gke-960651056514-22510dc8a6f938558e24 configure-helper.sh[1262]: Directory Hash Seed:      ba50a9e5-27ea-4318-b28b-87933e415a84
Jan 13 09:13:45 gke-960651056514-22510dc8a6f938558e24 configure-helper.sh[1262]: Journal backup:           inode blocks
Jan 13 09:13:45 gke-960651056514-22510dc8a6f938558e24 configure-helper.sh[1262]: Mounting '/dev/disk/by-id/google-master-pd' at '/mnt/disks/master-pd'
Jan 13 09:13:45 gke-960651056514-22510dc8a6f938558e24 configure-helper.sh[1262]: Mounted master-pd '/dev/disk/by-id/google-master-pd' at '/mnt/disks/master-pd'
Jan 13 09:13:45 gke-960651056514-22510dc8a6f938558e24 useradd[1323]: new group: name=etcd, GID=5015
Jan 13 09:13:45 gke-960651056514-22510dc8a6f938558e24 useradd[1323]: new user: name=etcd, UID=5015, GID=5015, home=/var/etcd, shell=/sbin/nologin
Jan 13 09:13:45 gke-960651056514-22510dc8a6f938558e24 configure-helper.sh[1262]: useradd: warning: the home directory already exists.
Jan 13 09:13:45 gke-960651056514-22510dc8a6f938558e24 configure-helper.sh[1262]: Not copying any file from skel directory into it.
Jan 13 09:13:45 gke-960651056514-22510dc8a6f938558e24 configure-helper.sh[1262]: Creating master auth files
Jan 13 09:13:45 gke-960651056514-22510dc8a6f938558e24 configure-helper.sh[1262]: /home/kubernetes/bin/configure-helper.sh: line 227: KUBE_BEARER_TOKEN: unbound variable
```

cc @kubernetes/sig-cluster-lifecycle-misc @roberthbailey @mikedanese

labels.description: Must be staffed and worked on either currently, or very soon, ideally in time for the next release.
labels.name: priority/important-soon

labels.name: sig/cluster-lifecycle

title: Cluster startup failed while looking for KUBE_BEARER_TOKEN
